MOL TOX 19.description: Seminar, one hour. Discussion of and critical thinking about topics of current intellectual importance, taught by faculty members in their areas of expertise and illuminating many paths of discovery at UCLA. P/NP grading.
MOL TOX 19.title: Fiat Lux Freshman Seminars

MOL TOX 197.description: Tutorial, four hours. Limited to juniors/seniors. Individual intensive study, with scheduled meetings to be arranged between faculty member and student. Assigned reading and tangible evidence of mastery of subject matter required. May be repeated for credit. Individual contract required. P/NP or letter grading.
MOL TOX 197.title: Individual Studies in Molecular Toxicology

MOL TOX 211A.description: Seminar, one hour twice per month. Seminar series which alternately features outside speakers and members of UCLA molecular toxicology community (students, postdoctoral fellows, and faculty) and deals with topics relevant to molecular toxicology. In Progress grading (credit to be given only on completion of courses 211B and 211C).
MOL TOX 211A.title: Molecular Toxicology Seminar

MOL TOX 211B.description: Seminar, one hour twice per month. Seminar series which alternately features outside speakers and members of UCLA molecular toxicology community (students, postdoctoral fellows, and faculty) and deals with topics relevant to molecular toxicology. In Progress grading (credit to be given only on completion of course 211C).
MOL TOX 211B.title: Molecular Toxicology Seminar

MOL TOX 211C.description: Seminar, one hour twice per month. Seminar series which alternately features outside speakers and members of UCLA molecular toxicology community (students, postdoctoral fellows, and faculty) and deals with topics relevant to molecular toxicology. S/U grading.
MOL TOX 211C.title: Molecular Toxicology Seminar

MOL TOX 296A.description: Research group meeting, two hours. Advanced study and analysis of current topics in molecular toxicology. Discussion of current research and literature in research specialty of faculty member teaching course. S/U grading.
MOL TOX 296A.title: Research Topics in Molecular Toxicology: Chemical Toxicology

MOL TOX 296B.description: Research group meeting, two hours. Advanced study and analysis of current topics in molecular toxicology. Discussion of current research and literature in research specialty of faculty member teaching course. S/U grading.
MOL TOX 296B.title: Research Topics in Molecular Toxicology: Molecular Carcinogenesis

MOL TOX 296C.description: Research group meeting, two hours. Advanced study and analysis of current topics in molecular toxicology. Discussion of current research and literature in research specialty of faculty member teaching course. S/U grading.
MOL TOX 296C.title: Research Topics in Molecular Toxicology: Teratogenesis

MOL TOX 296D.description: Research group meeting, two hours. Advanced study and analysis of current topics in molecular toxicology. Discussion of current research and literature in research specialty of faculty member teaching course. S/U grading.
MOL TOX 296D.title: Research Topics in Molecular Toxicology: Molecular Topics in Boron Biology

MOL TOX 296E.description: Research group meeting, two hours. Advanced study and analysis of current topics in molecular toxicology. Discussion of current research and literature in research specialty of faculty member teaching course. S/U grading.
MOL TOX 296E.title: Research Topics in Molecular Toxicology: Germ Cell Cytogenetic/Genetic Biomarkers

MOL TOX 296F.description: Research group meeting, two hours. Advanced study and analysis of current topics in molecular toxicology. Discussion of current research and literature in research specialty of faculty member teaching course. S/U grading.
MOL TOX 296F.title: Research Topics in Molecular Toxicology: Genetic Toxicology

MOL TOX 296G.description: Research group meeting, two hours. Advanced study and analysis of current topics in molecular toxicology. Discussion of current research and literature in research specialty of faculty member teaching course. S/U grading.
MOL TOX 296G.title: Research Topics in Molecular Toxicology: Laboratory Analysis

MOL TOX 375.description: Seminar, to be arranged. Preparation: apprentice personnel employment as teaching assistant, associate, or fellow. Teaching apprenticeship under active guidance and supervision of regular faculty member responsible for curriculum and instruction at UCLA. May be repeated for credit. S/U grading.
MOL TOX 375.title: Teaching Apprentice Practicum

MOL TOX 596.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. Individual guided studies under direct faculty supervision. May not be applied toward degree course requirements. May be repeated for credit. S/U or letter grading.
MOL TOX 596.title: Directed Individual Study or Research

MOL TOX 597.description: Tutorial, four hours. May not be applied toward degree course requirements. May be repeated for credit. S/U grading.
MOL TOX 597.title: Preparation for Ph.D

MOL TOX 599.description: Tutorial, to be arranged. May not be applied toward degree course requirements. May be repeated for credit. S/U grading.
MOL TOX 599.title: Ph.D

MOL TOX 99.description: Tutorial (supervised research or other scholarly work), three hours per week per unit. Entry-level research for lower division students under guidance of faculty mentor. Students must be in good academic standing and enrolled in minimum of 12 units (excluding this course). Individual contract required; consult Undergraduate Research Center. May be repeated. P/NP grading.
MOL TOX 99.title: Student Research Program

MOL TOX M110A.description: (Same as Pharmacology M110A.) Lecture, four hours (seven weeks); discussion, four hours (three weeks). Requisites: Life Sciences 2, 3. Introduction to pharmacology and toxicology for undergraduate students, emphasizing drug development and mechanisms of action of drugs and toxic agents. Letter grading.
MOL TOX M110A.title: Drugs: Mechanisms, Uses, and Misuse

MOL TOX M241.description: (Same as Pharmacology M241.) Lecture, six hours. Preparation: organic and biological chemistry. Designed for molecular and medical pharmacology students. Introduction to general principles of pharmacology. Role of chemical properties of drugs in their distribution, metabolism, excretion, and modes of action. S/U or letter grading.
MOL TOX M241.title: Introduction to Chemical Pharmacology and Toxicology

MOL TOX M242.description: (Same as Environmental Health Sciences M242.) Lecture, one hour; discussion, one hour. Preparation: undergraduate biology and chemistry courses. Requisite: Environmental Health Sciences C240. Examination of recent literature on mechanisms of toxicity or toxicodynamics. Student presentation of papers selected by instructor on various aspects of toxic mechanisms, including free radical mechanisms, mechanisms of cell death, metal toxicity/ion homeostasis, intracellular pH and calcium regulation, stress and adaptive pathways, DNA repair/mutagenesis, carcinogenesis, and teratogenesis. Discussion of various papers. S/U or letter grading.
MOL TOX M242.title: Toxicodynamics

MOL TOX M247.description: (Same as Environmental Health Sciences M241.) Lecture, three hours; discussion, one hour. Comprehensive and practical examination of emerging science of gene-environment interaction. Discussion of primary components of field, including role of metabolic pathways in modifying environmental responses and importance of environmental influences in human disease. Exploration of selected hot topics infield, such as importance of epigenetics and of microbiome. S/U or letter grading.
MOL TOX M247.title: Advanced Concepts in Gene-Environment Interactions
